name: alas
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
an expression of sadness or disappointment, especially when there is no hope that a situation will change: "Alas!" cried the man. I love football but, alas, I have no talent as a player. "Will you be able to come tomorrow?" "Alas, no." alas and alack (also alack and alas)
an expression of great sadness or disappointment: Alas and alack, he will not help me. Alack and alas, the food was spoiled. Alas and alack, nobody at that time had the job of fact-checking the statements of state officials. He tried to behave, but alas and lack, he ended up back in prison. Alack and alas, the restaurant owner turned down my request.
